description:
Journal ISSN 
 (optional. Please enter just one ISSN associated with your journal, which can be print or electronic)

Type of peer review
 Single blind - reviewers are anonymous to the author. Double blind - reviewers and authors are
 anonymous to each other.
type: Single blind, Double blind, Not blinded, unsure, other

description: Peer review form URL (a copy of the peer review form)
Peer reviewer activity deposited into open databases? Examples include Publons and ORCID
Peer review reports - published?, attributes (An example of "Conditional" publication: reviews are published unless the reviewer recommends rejection or withdraws.)
type:
Mandatory, Conditional, Optional, No, Not specified
 Attributes: Have date, Have DOI, Free to read (not paywalled), Under a Creative Commons License, Deposited into PubMed Central

description: Author responses to reviews - published?, attributes
Previous versions of the manuscript - published?, attributes

type: Mandatory, Conditional, Optional, No, Not specified

description: Reviewer identities revealed to the author (even if not published)?
Public commenting during formal peer review?
Open interaction (reviewers consult with one another)?

Additional OPR information
 Add any notes here about the nature of "conditional" publishing, etc
Co-reviewer policy Co-reviewers are people whom a peer reviewer invites to help them write a peer review. Often these are junior scholars in the same lab/group as the peer reviewer.
Dedicated place in the peer review form to identify co-reviewers?
Peer reviewer activity for co-reviewers deposited into open databases?
Version of the paper that can be posted to a preprint server
type:
No preprint policy
 None (preprints not allowed)
 First submission only (before peer review)
 After peer review (but not final, copyedited version)
 Any
 Unsure (preprints are allowed, but it's not clear what version)
 Other

description: Acceptable servers or characteristics of preprint servers
Preprints allowed in citation list? If citations are only permitted to preprints that appear in certain servers, please select and describe in "Other."
type:
Yes, in the reference list
 Yes, but only in the text (not the reference list)
 No
 Not specified
 Unsure
 Other

description: Link provided to preprint version of a paper?
Preprint media coverage policy What type of coverage about preprints is permitted? (eg blog posts, social media, news outlets, etc). Paste the policy here.
Preprint licensing policy What licenses (CC BY, etc) are permitted for preprints?
Scoop protection policy "Scoop protection" refers to policies about whether submitted preprint will be rejected if a competing work comes out in another journal after the date of preprinting.
